Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Genome compatibility and Euclidean distance
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770313; y=CC8xaihf3rTOTIkZHDidvgXaziEJ97Fr5mbLY7gHP0qVOtftMGw5

Hi Peter,

Very simply, we say that a missing connection gene is effectively a
weight of zero. So each connection innovation ID represents a
dimension (or axis if you prefer) and a connection weight is the
location along that axis. If a genome doesn't have a connection gene
with that particular ID then it is at position 0 on that axis.

Make sense?

Colin
